intro: Pilosella apatelia subsp. bregensis, commonly known as the Bregen's cat's-paw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in a composite head, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or grassy habitats and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its range.
